Package org.neo4j.io.fs

Class ReadAheadChannel<T extends StoreChannel>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.io.fs.ReadAheadChannel<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of StoreChannel wrapped
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, PositionableChannel, ReadableChannel, ReadableChecksumChannel
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReadAheadLogChannel
    public class ReadAheadChannel<T extends StoreChannel>
extends Object
implements ReadableChecksumChannel, PositionableChannel
    A buffering implementation of ReadableChannel. This class also allows subclasses to read content spanning more than one file, by properly implementing next(StoreChannel).

      • get

        public void get​(byte[] bytes,
                int length)
         throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: ReadableChannel
        Reads the next length bytes from this channel and puts them into bytes. Will throw ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if length exceeds the length of bytes.
        Specified by:
        get in interface ReadableChannel
        Parameters:
        bytes - byte[] to put read bytes into.
        length - number of bytes to read from the channel.
        Throws:
        IOException - I/O error from channel.
        ReadPastEndException - if not enough data was available.

      • endChecksumAndValidate

        public int endChecksumAndValidate()
                           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: ReadableChecksumChannel
        Mark the end for checksum calculations. This method will go through a number of stages:
        • Calculate the checksum over the stream since the call to ReadableChecksumChannel.beginChecksum().
        • Read the checksum at the current position.
        • Validate the checksum. Throws ChecksumMismatchException if not.
        Specified by:
        endChecksumAndValidate in interface ReadableChecksumChannel
        Returns:
        the checksum that was validated.
        Throws:
        IOException - I/O error from channel.

        public void beginChecksum()
        Description copied from interface: ReadableChecksumChannel
        Mark position from where checksum should be calculated from.
        Specified by:

      • next

        protected T next​(T channel)
          throws IOException
        Hook for allowing subclasses to read content spanning a sequence of files. This method is called when the current file channel is exhausted and a new channel is required for reading. The default implementation returns the argument, which is the condition for indicating no more content, resulting in a ReadPastEndException being thrown.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel that has just been exhausted.
        Throws:
        IOException - on I/O error.

        IOException
